content: In the Mediterranean Sea, the Balearic island of Formentera, off the coast of Spain, is surrounded by Posidonia oceanic grass, “neptune’s grass,” which soaks up carbon, acting as “the lungs of the Mediterranean.” Just one square meter of this seagrass produces as much oxygen as a hectare (2.471 acres) of the Amazon rainforest__no.0724, 2021. #carbonsink
